original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽17.28. Sanidassanattika, Vedanāttika🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  sa ni dassana ttika vedanā ttika  anidassana appaṭigham sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental phenomena, the Paṭṭhāna text with the subcommentary🔽The visible-data base, the feeling base

original: nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā🔽cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā  ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a root-cause condition.🔽With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a prenascence condition … a postnascence condition … a support condition … a dissociation condition … a presence condition … a non-disappearance condition.

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho🔽nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā🔽cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ  na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā  ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a faculty condition … a nutriment condition … a dissociation condition … a presence condition … a non-disappearance condition.🔽With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a root-cause condition … a prenascence condition … a postnascence condition … a support condition … a dissociation condition … a presence condition … a non-disappearance condition.🔽With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a root-cause condition … a prenascence condition … a postnascence condition … a support condition … a dissociation condition … a presence condition … a non-disappearance condition.

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so, there is a visible-data base that is not-inconstant and not-not-so related to it by condition being a root-cause condition … a prenascence condition … a postnascence condition … a support condition … a dissociation condition … a presence condition … a non-disappearance condition.🔽With respect to a visible-data base that is not-inconstant

original: naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is not associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling arises with resultant condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With root cause as condition, six. With object as condition, three. … With non-restraint as condition, six.
